page.title: 08Hartlepool Public Transport
page.content: Apart from the Hartlepool Borough Transport and Cleveland Transit, all the bus companies use the United bus station. The Hartlepool Borough Transport has its own depot in Lynn Street but it and Cleveland Transit largely use bus stops in Church Street as termini. Hartlepool's own bus services are covered by 75 single deck busses of the Bristol Rell, Leyland National and Dennis Falcon types. These busses operate on 15 main routes and several sub-routes to service local schools and industries. Local bus fares, set by the local transport authority, depend upon the number of 'stages' a passenger travels. Each stage is approximately half a mile but in practice it is measured between bus stops.
